title: 107_hr2787
content:
SECTION 1. REFERENCE. This Act amends sections of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. SEC. 2. FINDINGS AND PURPOSE. Congress finds that two-thirds of mothers with children under 6 are in the workforce, over 10% of young children have disabilities, and there is limited availability of infant care, care for special needs children, and care during nonstandard hours, especially in low-income communities. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act mandates early intervention and special education preschool services for children with disabilities. The purpose of this Act is to increase quality child care for children with disabilities, who are often excluded from child care programs due to myths, stereotypes, and lack of staff training. The Act aims to improve the quality of child care by including families with children with disabilities in child care programs. Section 658G (42 U.S.C. 9858e) is amended to require states to allocate at least 5 percent of funds for activities that increase quality child care for children with disabilities, including training and technical assistance. The amended Section 658G requires states to allocate 5% of funds for activities supporting quality child care for children with disabilities. This includes training child care providers, licensing agencies, and parents on collaborating for ADA and IDEA implementation, providing technical assistance for including children with disabilities in child care settings, training on assistive technology, and developing leadership skills. The curr_chunk focuses on training directors of child care facilities in leadership skills for inclusive programs, assisting child care resource agencies with ADA and IDEA compliance, and providing grants for staff recruitment and retention through scholarships for education and training in child development. The Secretary shall make grants and low-interest loans to public agencies and nonprofit organizations for projects that increase the availability of inclusive child care programs, child care for infants, and child care during evenings and weekends. SEC. 5. REPORTS.

Section 658K(a)(1)(B)(iii) is amended to include "disability status" in addition to age.

SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS.

Section 658P is amended to define "child with a disability" and "inclusive child care program."
